intro: Descurainia bourgaeana, commonly known as the African mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard species. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its seeds are small and elongated. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
